intro: Siphocampylus meridensis, commonly known as the desert bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to survive in dry, hot environments. Its leaves are narrow and grayish-green, reducing water loss through transpiration. Siphocampylus meridensis produces showy blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer.
